title: Drawing, Page of a sketchbook; Execution of a queen (Mary, Queen of Scots?) and scenes with Christ, ca. 1590
title_raw: Page of a sketchbook; Execution of a queen (Mary, Queen of Scots?) and scenes with Christ
medium: Bistre, pen and wash on laid paper
inscribed: boio, dehen, Regina, dami / ce (?), 13 piedi quadri alta 2
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Horizontal rectangle. Obverse: The Queen lies on her back, her neck resting on an execution block. A man binds her. The executioner raises an axe. Two men stand upon the scaffold, others kneel at left, beside it. Two women kneel beside the Queen, forming an oblong. Two persons at left and at right. The scaffold has been erected in a court. Written over the executioner: "boio"; beside the upper right corner of the scaffold: "dehen"; below the figure of the Queen: "Regina" and "dami / ce" (?); in the front of the scaffold: "13 piedi quadri alta 2." Reverse, at left: An arch is in the background. At right St. Peter in reflective pose. The room is lighted by a large candle. Damaged upper right, uneven bottom edges. Discloring on top. Spots. Scratching holes at the upper edge.

participants.person_name: Jan van der Straet, called Stradanus

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Page of a sketchbook; Execution of a queen (Mary, Queen of Scots?) and scenes with Christ, ca. 1590. Bistre, pen and wash on laid paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-143
